Topic.Title: The Morphing of Intel's Monopoly

Message.Msg: The manufacturing cost difference between the two: $252 vs $237 ($15) is nearly 100% in the CPU. QCOM Snapdragon600 is $20 vs Samsung $28 QCOM based unit needs 1 battery $5.25 and Samsung CPU version needs 2 batteries for $10.50. $8 CPU + $5.25 extra battery = $13.25 of the $15 difference.

Message.Title: Intel's XMM (TM) 7160 LTE platform successfully tested in the Vodafone Innovation Park Labs
Message.Msg: vodafoneDOTde/innovationpark/newsletter-english-april-2013_212101DOThtml During the course of several months of intensive collaboration, the Vodafone Innovation Park Labs successfully certified Intel's XMMTM 7160 LTE platform in accordance with Vodafone's global test criteria. The XMMTM 7160 platform from Intel is one of the smallest and most energy-efficient multimodal LTE platforms (LTE/HSPA+/EDGE), which can simultaneously cover a wide range of bands in all significant radio technologies. It is intended for use in smartphones, tablets, UltrabooksTM and machine-to-machine modules. The platform supports LTE with up to 100 Mbit/s in the downlink and 50 Mbit/s in the uplink. DC-HSPA+ (up to 42 Mbit/s), HSUPA (up to 5.7 Mbit/s) and EDGE will also be supported. The modem platform supports four GSM bands, eight 3G bands and 15 LTE bands, and also provides IMS features such as VoLTE. As Stefan Wolff, Vice President of the Intel Architecture Group & General Manager of the Multi-Comm Mobile and Communications Group explains: "The successful and efficient cooperation with the Vodafone Innovation Park Labs allows our OEM partners to introduce consumer products such as tablets and smartphones onto the market with as little effort as possible. The close, intensive collaboration with Vodafone ensures maximum quality and stability in Intel's current and future modem and phone platforms, which in turn allows our OEM customers to provide outstanding quality on rollout of the product." Andreas Dorstel, Head of the Acceptance & Innovation Services Department in the Vodafone Innovation Park, is already looking forward to further cooperation for the next generations in order to ensure a high level of end customer satisfaction, bearing in mind the numerous Intel-based mobile communication products in the Vodafone network. [By the way, Renee James is a director at Vodafone]

Topic.Title: The Morphing of Intel's Monopoly

Message.Msg: "The questions is why did it take so long given that Samsung announced 28nm production 2 years ago?" *Because not all 28nm is equal - majority of TSMC is still SiON and NOT HKMG That does not answer the question but here is the answer to yours. The mobile companies chose SiON due to the low power characteristics. Mobile companies buy the majority of the wafers now which is why 28nm SiON revenues are higher than HKMG. That will change this year, TSMC will ship more 28nm HKMG wafers. AMD, NVDIA, Altera, Xilinx, Oracle etc..... the high performance companies have been buying 28nm HKMG wafers. That puts Samsung 1+ years behind TSMC on yield learning and production costs. Good thing Samsung does not break out their foundry numbers in regards to margins and profits. Nor will Intel I bet.

Topic.Title: The Morphing of Intel's Monopoly

Message.Msg: The mobile companies chose SiON due to the low power characteristics Is this why MediaTek can't get enough wafers? Is this why NVDA is late? RE: HKMG and TriGate "That puts Samsung 1+ years behind TSMC on yield learning and production costs. " That puts TSMC 4 + years behind Intel on yield learning and production costs. Intel processed Megatons of TriGate silicon....TSMC won't even publish cross section of their FinFets.... Apple will make a move for the very same reasons ALTR did. And Intel will go after TSMC et al mixed signal business - in case you missed the MSCC anoucement

Topic.Title: The Morphing of Intel's Monopoly

Message.Msg: Everybody in the semi industry gives too optimistic production estimates apart from Intel. The point you are missing about Samsung is that their 32nm HKMG came out about the same time as TSMC's 28nm HKMG as is of similar performance and density and it came out in volume as the Apple A6/A6X in the latest iPhone5/Pads. Samsung actually did a good job considering the absolute mess Global-Founderies made of their gate-first 32nm HKMG for so long. Their 28nm is a lower power evolution of their 32nm and not just a shrink which may account for some of the delay. Samsung is a big rich diversified company, I'm sure they will cope with the loss of Apple's business just fine, after all their Galaxy phones are taking business off Apple's all the time. They will also drop Qualcomm's Snapdragon once Intel have their LTE chip ready to pair with their Exynos series which will increase their own chip volume.

Message.Msg: Disregard, by the ARM camp analyst, of intel's ATOM potential is by far the best thing any ARM short investor has going for them. Simply, intel will execute it's plan for significant gain in market share of the tablet, ultra mobile PC space. Expect intel to post next quarter gains in product shipped and sales increases. Factories in full production and capacity. This will be the quarter of sales into the Q4 end user purchase cycle. OEM's (especially Apple) may ignore the ATOM, though at it's own peril. Simply, ATOM will outperform, use less power, and have more feature capability than an ARM powered Apple A6, even if Apple switches to ARM A15 for iPad, it will be too little, too late! I will be more surprised if Apple DOES NOT go ATOM for iPad 5. Likewise, Samsung Galaxy tab, will be severely under performed, when compared feature, and power to ATOM powered competitors. Big thing in the mix is Intel/Samsung Tizan, bodes well for China, especially with Chinese Govt, kind of, not comfortable with Google.

Message.Title: Qualcomm expected to grow while Apple shrinks its earnings?
Message.Msg: Did anybody notice that expectations for Qualcomm is for them to grow their earnings by 32% in 2 years while Apple is actually expected to slightly shrink its earnings? I believe Qualcomms market share of selling chips is alot more at risk due to Intel and Google working together than it is for Apple to lose market share.

Topic.Title: Qualcomm expected to grow while Apple shrinks its earnings?

Message.Msg: Examine the sources of QCOM revenues. Top of page 4 of their March 2013 10q SEC filing. Quarterly revenues from Licensing is $2.134 billion. Quarterly operating income is $1.877 billion. Same for last quarter, quarter before that, annually, .... licensing revenue exceeds their operating profit. From 50,000 feet up, it looks to me like QCOM is getting more licensing revenues than their profit. How much increment expenses are added by the licensing organization over not licensing at all? Not much. The gross margin of their licensing revenue is 99.9%. If you extracted the QCOM $2.134 billion licensing revenue from their profits, wouldn't their operating income be negative? With the world tilting toward 4G, guess where the 32% earnings is going to come from. QCOM is primarily an intellectual property company who makes and sells some chips below cost. ARMH with a US tattoo. Are these calculations correct?

Message.Title: Intel and ASUS launch Atom-powered ASUS Fonepad.
Message.Msg: Intel Corporation (Intel) and ASUSTeK Computer Inc. (ASUS) unveiled the much-anticipated Intel Atom powered ASUS Fonepad, a competitively priced handheld with 3G voice and mobile data to offer to deliver the best qualities of a smartphone and tablet in a sleek and compatible 7-inch device. Powered by the new Intel Atom Z2420/Z2460 processor with Android 4.1(upgradable to 4.2), Fonepad features a vibrant HD display with IPS technology for wide viewing angles and outstanding clarity. "Intel Atom processors empower users with a powerful mobile computing platform to experience fast and responsive applications in a multitude of devices, ranging from tablets to smartphones", said Khaldoun Aboul-Saoud, Regional Manager for Markets Development at Intel. "With the technology we've integrated into our processors, users are able to experience rich graphics and high-definition video, as well as running power intensive applications without sacrificing responsiveness or performance." "It is ideal to have a larger screen with entertainment, social media and other online activities now playing an increasingly important part in our mobile lifestyles. We are very excited to bring our latest innovation to this market," said Leon Yu, ASUS Middle East Regional Director for System Product Group. The latest Intel Atom™processor is optimized for the Android platform, providing power management and security tools while balancing performance, security and power efficiency for Android applications. ASUS Fonepad is idealfor people who value both the voice communication features of a smartphone and the entertainment opportunities afforded by a tablet, but prefer the convenience of carrying just one device. Fonepad is a sleek and compact tablet with a metallic design that can be held comfortably in one hand with a modern and stylish appeal, thanks to its light 340g weight and slim 10.4mm profile.

Topic.Title: Did you guys see the kick me article

This will linger until the attorney gets a few $$$ or Harvey realizes carrying this forward is worse. Intel fired the two culprits immediately. They were convicted of criminal offenses. Palacio is suing for unspecified damages and attorney fees. You would think that Palacio would pull his shirt around so he could see if their was anything on his back. That is what a 5-year old would do. He could have walked to the nearest room with a mirror so he could see for himself.
